comment: Professor Hooper is a really nice person and has many interesting stories to tell, however, in class he will not give much information which will help you on midterms or finals. A lot of it is reading on your own. Other than that, it's relatively easy class.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Hooper is an interesting person, but not fit to be a professor. His class is poorly structured, he gives out a quiz basically every time class meets; usually compare contrast paragraphs. You never know if the quiz is going to be at the beginning or end of class so be on time. As long as you read the textbooks and come to class you should get an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is not the move. The class itself is not hard but the way he structures his class makes it difficult. You basically don't learn anything in class and are expected to read the textbook thoroughly before every class. There are in-class quizzes, which are essay questions, every class. If you're going to take this class, take another pro
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: He talks about science more than he talks about history.

Professor Hooper has a relatively easy class. You have to read a chapter a week, and then take a quiz over it on 1 of the days you come in. Other than that you take 4 geography quizzes which are very simple, and he has a curve on all of them. If you get every country/body of water correct you will make over a 100. Midterm + final are take home.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: We had quizzes every day based on the assigned reading from the chapter. Basically he asks you to compare and contrast certain things from the chapter and you have 10 minutes to write a page on it. You have to attend class to pass. Sometimes he forgets to give a quiz and will assign it online instead. His midterm and final are take home essays.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof Hooper is not really a hard teacher to take, but the class isn't all that fun. Theres a quiz every class period, but if you read you'll pass. His lectures are long and pretty boring. The midterm was pretty hard because I didn't read in detail enough. If you have another option, I'd suggest you'd choose another.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Definitely do not take this class, reading every single night before class, quiz every single class sometimes 2 in one class. Boring lectures that don't make sense, im almost done with college and this is the hardest class ive ever taken and I would NEVER take him again, for any class. Awful professor who needs to retire
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Hooper is funny, nice and loves history. His lectures are incredibly boring esp if you don't like hist but go to class! Simple quizzes before each class count for attendance. Read the chapters and you'll be fine. The quizzes do become take home but you still must read. Lots of quizzes and 3 multiple essay question exams. Great class overall
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: He is a nice professor. You need to read 4050 pages of textbook before every class and take a compare and contrast style short quizzes. However, quizzes including mid and final-term are not much difficult if you have read textbook and taken his class carefully.

Textbook is definitely required because you will not learn anything from his lectures. He spends the majority of class time talking about himself so you need to teach yourself everything. Attendance is not mandatory but he has a compare and contrast, short answer quiz over the assigned reading every class. Overall, still an easy class.

Hooper is great! Every class period you will have a short compare and contrast essay quiz over the chapter you're going to be studying that day. Super easy. I made a 100 on every single quiz just by quickly scanning the chapters before class. Both exams are in essay format and easy. This class is interesting and an easy A. highly recommend.

At first I thought this class would be overwhelming, but it ended up not being hard for me at all. There is a lot of reading and quizzes (compare and contrast) in every class period you attend, sometimes online. If there is no quiz he passes around an attendance sheet.  Overall, after the first few weeks of school I found this course pretty easy.

He gives quizzes in class everyday and it is over the reading you have to do every night. The reading is at least 40 pages each out of the book, then his quizzes are essay response and you have answer a specific question about the chapter. He let us do a take home final and I got at 75 even though all of my answers were straight out of the book.

For a history class, I thought it was easy. Just dedicate an hour before each class reading the chapter. There's a quiz every class on the chapter. It's an easy quiz if you read the chapter assigned. Only two tests- midterm and final. Final is online so that's a piece of cake. Overall, very minimum effort was put in for an A in the class. Just read

He was very engaging and I looked forward to this class every time I had it. Be ready for quizzes in almost every class, but they aren't your run of the mill quizzes. He wants to actually know that you learned from your reading. READ YOUR BOOK and show up to class and you'll be fine. Midterm and final are the only tests but don't stress over them.

COME TO CLASS! Quiz every class. Read the summary for each chapter. Do the extra credit paper, even if you think you don't need it. Review all quiz questions, they will be seen again. Do exactly as he says when comparing and contrasting. He is an awesome teacher, optimistic, super funny. His tangents are informational and quite funny.

Incredible professor, willing to work one on one with you, quiz/day over req readings, values understanding over specifics, grades leniently, allows make-ups if provided reason via e-mail, great overall teacher, captivating lectures accompanied by impressive repertoire of personal advents which make class enjoyable. Highly Recommend this teacher.

Really boring, he goes off on tangents that are extremely pointless. Quizzes every class which helps learn the content. Respond to questions very negatively, makes you feel like you can't ask questions. Easy class, but would be easier with a better teacher.

Prof Hooper will teach you differently. If you are willing to rad prior to class and show up to take his essays then you will get a good grade. I'm still in his class and have all A's on quizes and exams. He will teach you and give you the insight of the US History. Great prof. very helpful. Would recommend to anyone who is a History major.

Prof Hooper, will give you the insight of all the major stories that happened in US History. If you are willing to read prior to class then you wont have any problems of getting a good grade.He is very helpful and he tries to reach out to students. I would recommend his class to anyone who is a History major. His style of teaching is the best.
all we mostly did was small essays comparing & contrasting which was easy. But you have to come to class every time to do the small essays. which is 3 to 5 sentences.

Good class.  He took over from another professor during the semester and did a commendable job of working it all out fairly for the class.  Some interesting lectures when he added beyond the text.  Students were whiny about putting forth the necessary effort to get a decent grade.  He successfully got them to rise to the occasion.
Fun teacher. Very helpful. A lot of required reading but a fair grader.
interesting lectures somedays, quiz almost everyday, but easy oppurtunity to make up if missed

I really liked the class and his old school style of quizes everyclass was kinda refreshing.  It kept you on task with the material.  I got an 98 in the course by reading the material and doing every daily quiz.  Easy A if you put in the effort.
Loves compare and contrast to death. Quizzes every class. He seems mean but he actually cares and is willing to work with you, you just need to speak up and talk with him.

worse professor of KSU. very unclear of what he wants from us. quiz every single class session. be ready to read at least 60-70 pages prior to class. very mean and does not care about students. most prof's have pros and cons. He has ALL cons. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

He is very boring. His lectures are pointless. I didn't learn a thing and History is my favorite subject. Save yourself by NOT taking his class. You will regret it if you do. Spring 2011 was his first semester teaching and you can definitely tell.

Had him for world history. His lectures weren't on topic & veryyyy boring. You get 3 grades total in the class: midterm, final, & a few points for quizes. Quizes are everyday so you cant skip class. DONT BUY THE BOOK! The book has an online website with outlines for every chapter, plenty of information supplied.
